channel.title: How can I do 'more'
channel.description: Well, I just Installed Linux on my secondary Hdd (40 gig) and windows xp is on my main (120 gb)... Basically I have Ubuntu with the special effects added... How can I have it like a cube... and with rain drops and shit?

item.title: How can I do 'more'
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:9, topic:238892”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=315139.msg2505023#msg2505023 date=1224885798]
Well, I just Installed Linux on my secondary Hdd (40 gig) and windows xp is on my main (120 gb)… Basically I have Ubuntu with the special effects added… How can I have it like a cube… and with rain drops and shit?
[/quote]

Most people install Linux to get more out of their system. What you are doing is getting more out of you system, and then filling it up again with graphic crap.[/quote]

It’ll still perform better than windows. There is nothing wrong with it.

Read full topic

item.title: How can I do 'more'
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

system > administration > synaptic package manager. just open up the manager and type in compiz and it should scroll down to compiz fusion, right click and click mark for installation then click apply.

Read full topic

item.title: How can I do 'more'
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

You need to install compiz-fusion to get all those special effects, thats what he means.

Read full topic
